title: Tziporah Malkah reveals the unusual way she lost 50kgs as she debuts her incredible transformation
text:
She's the ex-model, formally known as Kate Fischer, who's shed an impressive 50kg weight loss.

On Tuesday, Tziporah Malkah showed off her incredible transformation during an appearance on the Today Show - and revealed that she did it not with a diet, but with mind power.

The 45-year-old's hypnotherapist, Mark Stephens, revealed it was a matter of having to 'reset her thinking pattern' when it came to overeating triggers.

'It's not what you are putting in your mouth': Tziporah Malkah (pictured) revealed the unusual way she lost 50 kilos as she appeared on the Today show on Tuesday

'It's not what you are putting in your mouth as much as what you are putting in your mind,' Stephen told the program.

He said that he had to retrain her brain to control her emotional eating triggers and patterns so she could stop agonizing over food.

The show's host Georgie Gardner then asked the reality star how she reacts to food now, to which she replied: 'Now I push it away.'

Wow! The former model showed off her incredible transformation and revealed that she did it not with a diet, but with mind power

The 45-year-old's hypnotherapist, Mark Stephens (right) revealed it was a matter of having to 'reset her thinking pattern' when it came to overeating triggers

'Losing weight for us is nothing, we will cut off an arm to lose weight, we are shocking. We have all done it. It's the keeping it off,' she said.

The reality star went on to say that besides hypnotherapy, she also underwent a mini lipo tuck to improve her sagging skin across her mid-section, and a re-shaping of her hips with a Brazilian butt lift.

The former model, who was engaged to James Packer for two years in 1998, showed off her incredible new slim frame on A Current Affair on Monday night.

'I'm proud but also incredibly vain and love myself right now': Tziporah unveiled her 'final makeover' on Monday's A Current Affair (left), after previously weighing 120kg (right)

'[The] mental anguish from all the stresses of life are just not there anymore... And I think that's probably the greatest gift,' she told A Current Affair reporter Brady Halls.

Tziporah broke down in tears, clearly overwhelmed by how far she has come.

'I'm proud but I'm also incredibly vain,' the Sirens star declared at the end of the segment. 'I love myself right now.'

authors: Ali Daher For Daily Mail Australia
